title: Mozilla Firefox will finally add support for AV1 hardware acceleration
content:
Mozilla says it’s finally ready to add support for the AV1 codec in the Firefox browser. While competitors like Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge have long supported hardware-accelerated AV1 video codec, Firefox missed out on this feature. But at long last, the browser is finally catching up. According to a recent update spotted on Mozilla’s

The post Mozilla Firefox will finally add support for AV1 hardware acceleration appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Firefox will soon be adding support for the hardware-accelerated AV1 decoder. The feature will arrive as part of Firefox version 100.
